ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify

Class CachingClient<TClient extends ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify.RemoteClient>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify.CachingClient<TClient>

  • public class CachingClient<TClient extends ca.ualberta.cs.wrkify.RemoteClient>
extends java.lang.Object
    Caching wrapper around a RemoteClient. Only downloads and are cached. Uploads/deletes/searches/creates are passed transparently to the wrapped client. Once a download is cached, any further downloads of the same ID will return the cached object. An object can be re-downloaded by calling discardCached on its id.
    See Also:
    Cache, RemoteObject, RemoteClient

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CachingClient.CachingClientSearcher
      CachingClient Searcher is a searcher that searches the cache exclusively.
      class  CachingClient.CachingClientWrapperSearcher
      CachingClientWrapperSearcher Is a Searcher that that wraps a RemoteClient Searcher

    • Method Detail

      • discardCached

        public void discardCached(java.lang.String id)
        discard the cached changes to an object. this will force the use of the wrapped client to get future references to this object.
        Parameters:
        id - the id associated with the object you are discarding.

      • updateCached

        public void updateCached(RemoteObject obj)
        set obj as the cached version of itself.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to put in the cache.

      • downloadFromRemote

        public <T extends RemoteObject> T downloadFromRemote(java.lang.String id,
                                                     java.lang.Class<T> type)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        download the object referred to by id, from the wrapped RemoteClient rather then the cache.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the remote object.
        Parameters:
        id - the id associated with the object you want.
        type - the type of the RemoteObject.
        Returns:
        the RemoteObject of type T referred to by id.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when download fails.

      • createLocal

        public <T extends RemoteObject> T createLocal(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                              java.lang.Object... conArgs)
        create a remote object locally. this object will not be created on the server but can be uploaded later.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the RemoteObject.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of remote object to create.
        conArgs - the arguments to the constructor of the remoteObject.
        Returns:
        the newly created object.

      • uploadNew

        public <T extends RemoteObject> T uploadNew(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                            T obj)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        uploadNew uploads a remote object that does not exist on the server, and creates a new id for it. try to use create instead of this.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the object.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the object to upload.
        obj - the object you are uploading.
        Returns:
        the object that was uploaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the inner upload fails.
